General Headquarters-,British Amies in Prance, 28th May. 1918,kmSir,I have the honour to forward herewith a report received from the G .0.C., Royal Air Force, on the bombing raid carried out by the OCHEY Squadrons on the 24th instantI have the honour to be, Sir,Your obedient Servant,(Sd.) K,Wigram.B .G,for Field-Marshal,. Commanding -in-Ghie f, British Armies in France.The Secretary, War Office,LONDON, S.W. DETAILED REPORT ON BOMB RAID CARRIED OUT 24th MAY, 1918,12 De Havllland 9's left at 5.0 a.m. to bomb the Thysson Blast Furnaoes and Works at HAGENDIMil. Three maohines were forced to return having lost the formation (tho weather being very misty), and one machine was forced to return owing to engine trouble. Tho remainder reached the objective and dropped 16 112-lb. bombs from 14,000 feot. Eight bursts were seen just East of the Railway S.W. of TALANGE.The formation was attacked by 8 enemy aircraft ovor the objeotive; a combat ensued in which one enemy aircraft was driven down out of control and one pilot and one observer of No, 99 Squadron were wounded. The observation of bursts was very difficult owing to the fighting. The enemy aircraft were of the Albatrbss Scout D3 type. They wore driven off.The eight maohines returned safely at 8.10 a,m.Anti-airoraft activity was considerable and accurate.Four plates were exposed.(Sgd) R.A.PR0TJT, Major S.0.II.for Brigadier-General, In the Field. G.0,C'5 8th Brigade,Royal Air Force.25th May, 1918.
